channel.title: Mac help
channel.description: All right, I'd like to do these pretty things on my mac, I don't need to host a server, but I'd like to be able to code a server and test my self, not online just loaded so I can see how I did. If there is already a guide, link me to it, if not please give me the help you can, thanks, Les.

item.title: Mac help
item.dc:creator: @Les Les
item.description:
@Les wrote:

[quote=“Maxie35, post:4, topic:276450”]State your question more clear, you want to code a server? just download one from the download section and code it -.-

To test it, you will have to portforward, get java etc. to get on the server.[/quote]
Okay, then, I’m looking for step by step on getting to play on a base server I have. If someone could give me step by step.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 29, 2009, 03:24:59 pm[/size][hr]So no one does any of this on a mac?

Read full topic

item.title: Mac help
item.dc:creator: @Maxie35 Maxie35
item.description:
@Maxie35 wrote:

State your question more clear, you want to code a server? just download one from the download section and code it -.-

To test it, you will have to portforward, get java etc. to get on the server.

Read full topic

item.title: Mac help
item.dc:creator: @Les Les
item.description:
@Les wrote:

[quote=“Maxie35, post:2, topic:276450”]Well if you want only you to go on the server you should just do the same actually.

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Follow those instructions, you can skip the No-ip part, just use 127.0.0.1 as your ip to log on.[/quote]

This doesn’t help, thanks for the post though, that’s not mac problems, this should be simple I just need someone who knows how.

Read full topic

item.title: Mac help
item.dc:creator: @Maxie35 Maxie35
item.description:
@Maxie35 wrote:

Well if you want only you to go on the server you should just do the same actually.

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Follow those instructions, you can skip the No-ip part, just use 127.0.0.1 as your ip to log on.

Read full topic
